docs.snippet: With or without Luis Suarez, Uruguay faces a serious challenge keeping the Colombia juggernaut at bay in the last 16 of the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: With or without Luis Suarez, Uruguay faces a serious challenge keeping the Colombia juggernaut at bay in the last 16 of the World Cup.

docs.snippet: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez could be suspended from the World Cup for the second successive tournament after he appeared to bite Italy's Giorgio Chiellini on the shoulder during his team's 1-0 win on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez could be suspended from the World Cup for the second successive tournament after he appeared to bite Italy's Giorgio Chiellini on the shoulder during his team's 1-0 win on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: In many ways, it's a head-scratcher: the country that invented football and which has the richest, most watched and, many would agree, best league in global football is also one of the worst performers at this World Cup. How can that be?
docs.lead_paragraph: In many ways, it's a head-scratcher: the country that invented football and which has the richest, most watched and, many would agree, best league in global football is also one of the worst performers at this World Cup. How can that be?

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Wednesday:
docs.lead_paragraph: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Wednesday:

docs.snippet: FIFA has officially charged Uruguay's Luis Suarez with biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini in the teams' World Cup match, a process that could lead to a suspension for Uruguay's best offensive player.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has officially charged Uruguay's Luis Suarez with biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini in the teams' World Cup match, a process that could lead to a suspension for Uruguay's best offensive player.

headline.main: FIFA Charges Luis Suarez for Biting in World Cup
headline.print_headline: FIFA Charges Luis Suarez for Biting in World Cup

docs.snippet: For the third time in the past four years, Uruguay’s star striker, Luis Suárez, appeared to bite a player on the other team when he clashed with Italy’s Giorgio Chiellini in the second half.
docs.lead_paragraph: For the third time in the past four years, Uruguay’s star striker, Luis Suárez, appeared to bite a player on the other team when he clashed with Italy’s Giorgio Chiellini in the second half.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan striker Luis Suarez faces potential punishment for appearing to bite Italian defender Giorgio Chiellini during Uruguay's 1-0 victory over Italy in World Cup group stage; Suarez, who has emerged as one of the world's best players in the past year, has had two previous incidents of biting; FIFA has opened disciplinary proceedings that could result in his suspension.

headline.main: Uruguay’s Suárez, Known for Biting, Leaves Mark on World Cup
headline.print_headline: Uruguayan Star, Known for Biting, Leaves Mark on World Cup

docs.snippet: Colombia won Group C on Tuesday, as expected, and it will join Brazil, Chile and Uruguay in the same part of the Round of 16.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia won Group C on Tuesday, as expected, and it will join Brazil, Chile and Uruguay in the same part of the Round of 16.
